sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A prohibition to all persons who have set up any offices called by the names of addresses, publique advice, or intelligence within the cities of London and VVestminster, the borough of Southwark, and three miles about the same. Williams, Oliver, fl. 1657-1670.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for the author, and are to be had at the Sun in Paul's Church-yard, London : 1657.
Signed and dated at end: Oliver Williams. 26 day of May, 1657. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
